programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: The Japanese Grand Prix first practice session. Coverage of preparations for the third round of the season, held at Suzuka Circuit in Suzuka City, Japan. Ferrari's Lewis Hamilton will be looking to equal Michael Schumacher's record of seven Japanese Grand Prix wins over this weekend. Max Verstappen will be searching for his fourth win at this event after winning here on the last three occasions

programme.title: Live IPL
programme.sub-title: Lucknow Super Giants v Mumbai Indians 04.04
programme.desc: Lucknow Super Giants v Mumbai Indians. Coverage of the T20 match from BRSABV Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow. The hosts won this fixture last year by four wickets in a close match between the two sides. Mumbai made 144-7 in their 20 overs with Nehal Wadhera top-scoring with 46 from 41 balls, before the Super Giants chased down their target with four balls to spare

programme.title: Sky Sports News
programme.desc: Round-up of the sports news, with live analysis and comment, plus extended interviews with the headline-makers

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Blackburn Rovers v Middlesbrough (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match from Ewood Park, as the two play-off contenders go head to head. Both teams are on the cusp of the top six and a victory here for either side would boost their play-off hopes and dent the others. Blackburn have faced Middlesbrough twice this season with both games at the Riverside Stadium, and both games saw the North West club pick up 1-0 wins

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Valero Texas Open. Coverage of day two of the tournament from TPC San Antonio. This event has been dominated by American golfers since the turn of the century, with 19 of the 24 winners since 2000 coming from the United States. Previous winners in the 21st century include Zach Johnson, Adam Scott, Jordan Spieth, Charley Hoffman and Justin Leonard, who has succeeded three times since his first win in 2000

programme.title: Fantasy Football Pre-Match

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Luton Town v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.30pm). Coverage of the Championship match from Kenilworth Road, in a game that affects both ends of the table. The hosts desperately need points to stay in the league and avoid two successive relegations, while the visitors need a win to keep the pressure on their automatic promotion rivals Sheffield United and Burnley. The reverse fixture at the end of November saw Leeds win a one-sided match 3-0 at Elland Road

programme.title: Gillette Labs Soccer Saturday
programme.desc: Stay up to speed with the afternoon's football up and down the country as goals go in and updates arrive in the studio from around the grounds

programme.title: Live: SNF
programme.desc: Aston Villa v Nottingham Forest (Kick-off 5.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Villa Park, as both sides meet in an important game in both sides' season's. Both clubs are in the mix for a Champions League place, especially with the chance of an extra place being available for next year's competition. The reverse fixture back in December saw Forest score two late goals to come from behind to win the game 2-1

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Valero Texas Open. Coverage of day three of the tournament from TPC San Antonio. America's Akshay Bhatia won this event last year when he beat fellow American Denny McCarthy in a play-off to claim the winner's share of $1.65 million. He became the seventh American golfer to win this tournament in the last 10 years, following on from the likes of Jordan Spieth, Jimmy Walker and Kevin Chappell
